Body:
I have a React-native app that I need to connect with IoT (AWS), with websockets. I currently use the package react-native-paho-mqtt to connect my app. Here is my code : 

function getClient(onConnect
column11: onMessageArrived) {	  logger.trace('getClient()');	  const clientID = uuidV4();	  // Create a client instance	  const client = new Paho.MQTT.Client(signedUrl
column12: clientID);  // eslint-disable-line no-undef		  // set callback handlers	  client.onConnectionLost = onConnectionLost;	  client.onMessageArrived = onMessageArrived;		  // connect the client	  client.connect({	    keepAliveInterval: 15
column15:
}); return client; }

5 minute after my main connection
column16:
I get an error when I try to connect an other client. I get this error: AMQJS0007E Socket error:{0}.. I do not have any more information about the error.

Does anyone know what is happening or how to solve this problem ?

Body: How many clients do you create? Maybe you are hitting the client limit ?
Do you have the logs from the broker you are connecting to?
